elements.content: 8XRPD patterns of p- and r-Co3O4 and the JCPDS file of Co3O4 as a reference.SEM and TEM images. (a)–(c) for p-Co3O4, and (d)–(f) for r-Co3O4.Electrochemical characteristics of p-Co3O4 and r-Co3O4 in the left and right columns, respectively. (a and b) Potential profiles during lithiation and delithiation at the first and second cycles. (c and d) Capacity retention during the repeated cycles of charge and discharge at 0.1 C for 100 cycles. (e and f) Capacity dependency on discharge rates. Charge rates were fixed at 0.1 C.
